definition: see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
lit. the cow licking its calf fondly (idiom)/fig. to show deep affection towards one's children
lit. an old ox licking its calf (idiom)/fig. (of parents) to dote on one's children
the love of a cow licking her calf (idiom)/parental love

sentences.english: Oliver wet his great thumb briefly.
sentences.chinese: 奧立佛凝神舐了一舐大拇指。

sentences.english: Oliver wet his great thumb briefly.
sentences.chinese: 奧立佛凝神舐了一舐大拇指。

sentences.english: The Spanish dog now happily licks my hand.
sentences.chinese: 那條西班牙種的狗如今樂滋滋地在舐我的手了。

sentences.english: Flames are licking at their walls.
sentences.chinese: 熊熊的火焰舔舐着牆腳。

sentences.english: They could be lying low and licking their wounds.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能正俯下身子舔舐他們的傷口。

sentences.english: The cat's tongue rasped my hand.
sentences.chinese: 貓的舌頭在我手上舐來舐去。

sentences.english: The cat's tongue rasped my hand.
sentences.chinese: 貓的舌頭在我手上舐來舐去。

sentences.english: Then try the "pointy-tongue" technique to stroke up and down and side to side.
sentences.chinese: 然後試着使用“舌尖”技巧來上下左右舔舐。

sentences.english: His warm moist tongue would caress the hand of his master.
sentences.chinese: 它會用溫潤的舌頭舔舐主人的手。

sentences.english: Safe and sound, the lioness gives the cub a big welcome-back lick.
sentences.chinese: 安全返回後，母獅舐慰受驚的幼獅。

definition: variant of 咬嚙|咬啮[yao3 nie4]/to gnaw
to press against/to nuzzle up to
to chew/to masticate/to ruminate/to mull over
